results.purpose: Tracks CMA (Consumer & Marketing Area) squad organization, ownership, KPIs, and resources for Q1 2026
key_data_points: Q1 2026 KPIs defined for most squads
Key metrics include: Profile Completion Rate, Add-to-Cart Rates, CLV, Net Revenue, API endpoint migrations, Feature deployment frequency, User engagement ratios
Multiple brand ventures: Factor Form, Good Chop, The Pets Table
Consumer Core focused on API-v2 migration across customer, subscription, and deliveries domains
Loyalty program structure with Missions, Rewards, and Share squads

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM for entire Consumer Core tribe (4 squads)

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: New Ventures squad tracking Factor Penetration % at factor75.com

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: New Ventures squad tracking Net Revenue at goodchop.com

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: New Ventures squad tracking Net Revenue at thepetstable.com

entities.name: HelloFresh app
entities.context: Primary platform for Engagement tribe metrics (downloads, DAU/MAU ratio)

entities.name: API-v2
entities.context: Migration target for Consumer Core squads across multiple domains

entities.name: Jira
entities.context: Project management tool with backlog links for most squads

entities.name: Slack
entities.context: Communication channels defined for each squad

insights: Organization structure: 7 tribes (Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, Loyalty & Virality, UX)
Shopping Foundation is the largest tribe with 5 squads focused on cart, personalization, platform, customer service, and cross-selling
New Ventures tribe manages 4 separate brand initiatives with revenue-focused KPIs
Consumer Core has unified PM leadership (Fiona Lucas) but distributed EM ownership, suggesting centralized product strategy
Technical debt focus: Consumer Core squads measuring API-v2 endpoint migration progress
Platform maturity emphasis: Consumer Foundations tracking deployment frequency and feature velocity
Engagement strategy spans content (Inspire), activity (Act), and virality (Share)
Loyalty program decomposed into three specialized squads: Missions (completion), Rewards (redemption), Share (organic growth)
Some squads lack complete information (missing Jira links, UX squads have no PM/EM listed)
Mix of business metrics (revenue, penetration) and technical metrics (API endpoints, deployment frequency) indicates balanced product-engineering focus

results.purpose: Tracks CMA (Consumer & Marketing Area) squad organization, ownership, KPIs, and resources for Q1 2026
key_data_points: Q1 2026 KPIs defined for most squads
Key metrics include: Profile Completion Rate, Add-to-Cart Rates, CLV, Net Revenue, API endpoint migration, Feature deployment frequency, User engagement ratios
Mix of product squads (Shopping Journey, New Ventures) and platform squads (Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations)
API-v2 migration tracking for Consumer Core squads
New Ventures tracking Net Revenue and penetration metrics

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with app downloads and customer engagement metrics

entities.name: Factor75/Factor Form
entities.context: New venture with Factor Penetration % KPI

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: Pet food venture tracking Net Revenue

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM for entire Consumer Core tribe (4 squads)

entities.name: Jira
entities.context: Project management tool with backlog links for most squads

entities.name: Slack
entities.context: Communication channels listed for each squad

insights: Organization structure: 7 tribes (Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, Loyalty & Virality, UX)
Consumer Core tribe has unified PM leadership (Fiona Lucas) but distributed EM ownership
New Ventures squads focus on revenue metrics, indicating growth/monetization focus
Consumer Foundations emphasizes developer productivity (deployment frequency, feature velocity)
Several Jira links noted as inaccessible ('Can't find link'), suggesting access control issues
UX tribe (Insights & Innovation, Content Design & Localization) lacks PM/EM assignments and KPIs, indicating possible support/shared service model
Engagement and Loyalty tribes focus on user activation and retention metrics (DAU/MAU, mission completion, reward redemption)
Shopping Foundation has largest squad count (5 squads), indicating complexity in core shopping experience
Some EM roles show interim assignments or future start dates (e.g., Bartosz Raciborski starts Jan 1st)
